newsitem.title: UK: Mowlem to spin off SGB Group in June.
newsitem.headline: Mowlem to spin off SGB Group in June.

text.p: British building group John Mowlem and Co Plc said on Wednesday it planned to float its SGB scaffolding business on the London Stock Exchange on June 25 but would retain a controlling stake. The company said the flotation will provide SGB Group Plc with the freedom to manage its development independently of Mowlem and will enhance SGB's growth potential by giving it direct access to the capital markets.
SGB is expected to be valued at between 130 and 140 million stg at the issue price.
The pathfinder prospectus, published last Monday, showed that SGB made a pre-tax profit of 13.9 million stg for the year to December 31 1996.
Dresdner Kleinwort Benson have been appointed financial advisers to Mowlem and sponsors for the issue with NatWest Markets as financial advisers to SGB.
